p: Studying the EO composition of S. officinalis in nine Balkan countries, Cvetkovikj Karanfilova et al. [ 21] found a high content in α-thujone, β-thujone, and camphor in a chemotype with samples from Croatia, another chemotype with Croatian samples characterized by a high content of camphor and β-pinene; a third chemotype, with the majority of the investigated populations, characterized by high content of α-thujone and camphor; and a chemotype formed by cultivated or naturalized plants with high contents in α-thujone and α-humulene.
